articles.title: About this blog
articles.description: Some additional details about the blog

articles.title: Zane's reading log!
articles.description:
A blog by default, but more like a public journal where I keep track of what
I am reading and thinking about. It makes me feel more accountable to do it
on the internet.

articles.title: Uses
articles.description: What do I use to make this blog and read papers?
articles.contents:
For reading
Right now, I currently print out my most important papers, draw on
them with a pen and highlighter, and put them in a filing cabinet under
my desk. I put them in a file folder labeled ‘current work’ and take
that home if I will need the papers at home. It is not a very efficient
system. In the future, I’m considering getting a tablet computer
explicitly for reading papers. I’m considering something from the
microsoft surface line so I can get instant compatibility with Calibre
and Zotero.
I use Zotero to store all my references. The only time I’ve used
another reference manager was to use EndNote for its quicker
deduplication method. After trying to use EndNote I think in the future
I will just deal with Zotero’s slower deduplication.
For blogging
This website was made with distill and R
Markdown. I also made a lot of adaptations based on Danielle
Navarro’s workflow and I use her refinery package to
create new posts (with renv if they are code heavy). I use
renv to manage the overall project dependencies as well. My
code is hosted on GitHub and hosted
via Netlify.
